result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harrison K. Helfand

defendant.name: Helfand, Harrison K.
defendant.address: 209 Division St Room 36, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Harrison K. Helfand in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-188 and 15CF-49.

9:10 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 2 in 15CF-49 - recommends withheld sentence, 5 yr probation, $250 fine, dna surcharge, 10 months jail, aoda and comply, absolute sobriety, no prescription drugs without a prescription, fill all prescriptions at a single pharmacy, sign health releases for agent,  no contact with T. Drengberg or J.A.H. with DOB of 7/27/99, obtain/maintain full time employment, DAAP or parenting type class, other counseling, no dangerous weapons, DNA sample if not already submitted, and write letter of apology. Count 1 would be dismissed and read in

15CF-188: Would be dismissed and read in

Atty Kryshak concurs.
State requests a PSI based on the G Felony. There will be an argument related to jail and length of supervision.

Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2, 15CF-49.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-49: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-49 Count 2:
15CF-188: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.
PSI to be given to parties at least one week prior to sentencing.

Parties to go to Judicial Assistant for a date.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding 15CF-188 regarding preliminary hearing.

Atty Kryshak waives preliminary hearing in 15CF-188.
Defendant concurs, waives right to preliminary hearing.

Court accepts waiver.
Court is given information.
Atty Kryshak has received a copy of the information, waives reading and enters NOT GUILTY plea.

Defendant Harrison K. Helfand in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Atty David Knaapen appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Kryshak asks to have set for a status on 6/15. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Kryshak

d.o.b. 11-23-1960
ADA  Knaapen appears in Court, on behalf of Atty Molepske.
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:17 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bailjumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Atty Knaapen addresses 15CF-49.

State addresses bond, asking that Court issue a $500 cash bond with conditions.

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.

Court questions Defendant. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  June 01, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

Court advises Defendant to contact his attorney, Atty Kryshak, regarding this charge.

Defendant is remanded to the custody of the jail pending posting of bond.

Comply with all conditions of bond as set forth in 15CF-49. Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.  Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
